keyFacts: The document contains a first-person account from an alleged victim describing repeated sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein on his private island.

The account describes a pattern where the victim was comforted after abuse by another woman who normalized and glamorized the activity, calling it something they 'had to do' to avoid being thrown off the island.
The facilitating woman is described as being emotionally close to Epstein, giving him daily massages, and diligently following his orders.
The correspondence includes an inquiry about legal deposition dates and a 'special date of release', suggesting ongoing legal proceedings related to the Epstein case in October 2018.
The document illustrates the use of psychological manipulation and peer pressure to coerce compliance with abuse.
